Extensive Evidence: You used multiple sprites, with multiple properties updated in the draw loop
Convincing Evidence: You used multiple sprites, each with at least one property updated inside the draw loop
Limited Evidence: You used at least one sprite, with at least one property updated after sprite creation.
No Evidence: You did not use any sprites, or no sprite properties are updated after the sprite is created.

Extensive Evidence: Your program responds to multiple types of user input and uses at least one random number
Convincing Evidence: Your program responds to user input and uses at least one random number
Limited Evidence: Your program uses a random number or responds to a user input.
No Evidence: Your program does not use random numbers or respond to user input.

Extensive Evidence: Your program is well sequenced and properly separates code in and out of the draw loop.
Convincing Evidence: Your program correctly separates code in and out of the draw loop to create animation. Your program may contain some incorrectly sequenced code.
Limited Evidence: Your program is animated through the draw loop, but some code is improperly placed in or out of the loop.
No Evidence: Your draw loop is not used to create animation

Extensive Evidence: Your program uses multiple conditionals inside the draw loop, at least one of which is triggered by a variable or sprite property
Convincing Evidence: Your program uses a conditional that is triggered by a variable or sprite property inside the draw loop.
Limited Evidence: Your program uses at least one conditional inside the draw loop.

Extensive Evidence: Multiple elements are placed on the screen using the coordinate system, and move in different ways.
Convincing Evidence: At least one element is placed on the screen using the coordinate system and moves during the program.
Limited Evidence: At least one element is placed on the screen using the coordinate system.
No Evidence: No elements (sprites or shapes) are placed on the screen using the coordinate system.

Extensive Evidence: Multiple variables are used and their values are updated during your program. At least one variable or property uses the counter pattern.
Convincing Evidence: At least one variable is used, and its value is updated during the program.
Limited Evidence: At least one variable is used in your program.
No Evidence: No variables are used in your program
